issues.description: The problem statement / UML specifies the Animal attribute 'name' as type String, but the solution implementation uses a StringBuilder for the name field (solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Animal.java). This is a structural mismatch in the attribute type that may confuse students inspecting the reference solution (they would naturally implement name as a String per the UML). Externally behavior is equivalent (the solution's getter returns a String), but the difference in declared type is an unintentional structural inconsistency.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's Animal.name attribute use the String type to match the UML and problem statement (e.g., private String name; public Animal(String name) { this.name = name; } public void setName(String name) { this.name = name; }). Alternatively, update the problem statement/UML to explicitly allow StringBuilder for the name, but changing the solution to String is the cleaner fix.
